properties.title: Add Session Hosts to Host Pool

elements.name: resourceScope
elements.instanceDetailsLabel: Virtual Machines Region and Resource Group

elements.name: prefix
elements.label: Deployment Prefix
elements.toolTip: The name of the resource group to deploy. (Default: AVD1)

constraints.validationMessage: The prefix can be 2-4 aphanumeric characters.

elements.name: environment
elements.label: Deployment Environment
elements.toolTip: The name of the resource group to deploy.

elements.name: vmNamePrefix
elements.label: Session Host Name Prefix
elements.toolTip: Session host prefix

constraints.validationMessage: The prefix can be 1-11 characters and must consist of only alphanumerics, underscores (_), or dashes (-).

elements.name: index
elements.label: Starting number (index)
elements.toolTip: Select the start number of the virtual machine suffix.

elements.name: count
elements.label: Number of Virtual Machines
elements.toolTip: Select the number of virtual machines to deploy in your AVD host pool.

elements.name: source
elements.label: Source
elements.toolTip: Select marketplace or build custom image to deploy the session hosts.

elements.name: offer
elements.label: Offer
elements.toolTip: Select the desired marketplace image offer.

elements.name: sku
elements.label: SKU
elements.toolTip: Select the desired marketplace image SKU.

elements.name: diskSku
elements.label: OS Disk SKU
elements.toolTip: Select the disk SKU for the operating system disk.

elements.name: vmSize
elements.label: VM Size
elements.toolTip: Select the size of the virtual machines. Multi-session hosts should have 4 - 24 vCPUs. Single session host should have 2 or more vCPUs.

elements.name: acceleratedNetworking
elements.label: Enable accelerated networking
elements.toolTip: Enables low latency and high throughput on the network interface.

elements.name: enableAntiMalwareExt
elements.label: Enable Antimalware extension
elements.toolTip: Enables Azure VM antimalware extension on session hosts.

elements.name: option
elements.defaultValue: [if(empty(first(map(first(map(filter(steps('sessionHosts').resourceSkusApi.value, (sku) => contains(sku.name, steps('sessionHosts').settings.vmSize)), (sku) => sku.locationInfo)), (sku) => sku.zones))), 'No infrastructure redundancy required', 'Availability Zones')]
elements.label: Availability Option
elements.toolTip: Select the redundancy / resiliency for the virtual machines.

constraints.allowedValues: [if(empty(first(map(first(map(filter(steps('sessionHosts').resourceSkusApi.value, (sku) => contains(sku.name, steps('sessionHosts').settings.vmSize)), (sku) => sku.locationInfo)), (sku) => sku.zones))), parse('[{"label":"No infrastructure redundancy required","value":"None"}]'), parse('[{"label":"Availability Zones","value":"AvailabilityZones"},{"label":"No infrastructure redundancy required","value":"None"}]'))]

elements.name: availabilityZones
elements.label: Select Availability Zones
elements.toolTip: Select the desired Availability Zones

constraints.allowedValues: [map(first(map(first(map(filter(steps('sessionHosts').resourceSkusApi.value, (sku) => contains(sku.name, steps('sessionHosts').settings.vmSize)), (sku) => sku.locationInfo)), (sku) => sku.zones)), (zone) => parse(concat('{"label":"Zone ', zone, '","value":"', zone, '"}')))]

elements.name: securityType
elements.label: Security Type
elements.toolTip: Select the appropriate Security Type configuration for the Virtual Machine. Note that 'Confidential Virtual Machines' are not available in all regions and the option may not appear.

elements.name: secureBootEnabled
elements.label: Enable Secure Boot
elements.toolTip: Secure boot helps protect your VMs against boot kits, rootkits, and kernel-level malware.

elements.name: vTpmEnabled
elements.label: Enable vTPM
elements.toolTip: Virtual Trusted Platform Module (vTPM) is TPM2.0 compliant and validates your VM boot integrity apart from securely storing keys and secrets.

elements.name: encryptionAtHost
elements.label: Encryption At Host
elements.toolTip: Check to enable Encryption At Host

elements.name: diskZeroTrust
elements.label: Enable Customer-Managed Keys on OS Disk
elements.toolTip: Enables a zero trust configuration on the session host disks.

elements.name: deployAntiMalwareExt
elements.label: Deploy Anti-Malware Extension
elements.toolTip: Deploys anti-malware extension on session hosts.

elements.name: identityServiceProvider
elements.label: Identity Service Provider
elements.toolTip:
Choose the identity service provider for your users and session hosts. Your choices explained:

Active Directory (ADDS): The users are sourced from ADDS and session hosts will be domain joined.

Microsoft Entra Domain Services: The users are sourced from Entra ID or ADDS and the session hosts are joined to Entra Domain Services.

Microsoft Entra ID: The users are sourced from Entra ID and the session hosts will join Entra ID.

Microsoft Entra ID Kerberos: The Users are sourced from ADDS, but the session hosts will be joined to Entra ID.

options.text: If you are deploying this solution with FSLogix Storage, storage account key access must be permitted within your subscription. This solution will securely configure your session host to access the FSLogix Azure Files storage with the storage account key.

elements.name: intuneEnrollment
elements.label: Intune enrollment
elements.toolTip: If Intune is configured in your Microsoft Entra ID tenant, you can choose to have the VM automatically enrolled during the deployment by selecting this box.

elements.name: identityDomainName
elements.label: Domain name
elements.toolTip: The full qualified domain name of the domain to which the virtual machines will be joined.

elements.name: ouPath
elements.label: OU Path
elements.toolTip: Optionally, input the distinguished name of the desired organization unit for the AVD session hosts.

elements.name: domainJoinUserPrincipalName
elements.label: Domain Join User Principal Name
elements.toolTip: The User Principal Name of the domain join account.

options.text:
This add-on requires that the following secret names and values are stored in a key vault that you will select below:
  • vmLocalUserName: The virtual machine administrator username.
  • vmLocalUserPassword: The virtual machine administrator password.

This add-on requires that the following secret names and values are stored in a key vault that you will select below:
  • domainJoinUserPassword: The password associated with the user principal name specified above.
  • vmLocalUserName: The virtual machine administrator username.
  • vmLocalUserPassword: The virtual machine administrator password.

elements.name: keyVault

elements.name: subnet
elements.label: Subnet
elements.toolTip: Select an existing subnet for the AVD session hosts.
